title: Calories in Chicken Pasta Alfredo
meta_description: Discover calories in chicken pasta alfredo for a standard serving, including macros like protein and fat, plus tweaks and FAQs for better meal planning.
assumptions: Standard homemade recipe: 100g cooked fettuccine, 100g grilled chicken breast, alfredo sauce (butter, heavy cream, parmesan); ~300g total serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, ingredients, and preparation; restaurant versions may differ. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One serving of chicken pasta alfredo provides ~650 kcal with 35 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use light cream in alfredo sauce

faqs.q: How many calories in chicken pasta alfredo per serving?
faqs.a: About 650 kcal for a standard 300g homemade serving.

faqs.q: What's the protein in chicken pasta alfredo?
faqs.a: Roughly 35 g protein from the chicken and cheese.

faqs.q: Is chicken pasta alfredo high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~35 g total fat, mostly from cream and butter in the sauce.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in chicken pasta alfredo?
faqs.a: Use light cream, less butter, or more veggies; can cut ~150 kcal.

faqs.q: Sodium content in chicken pasta alfredo?
faqs.a: Around 900 mg per serving, mainly from cheese and seasonings.
